prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, while the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are straight and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2:3:4. 1. **Create Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw Sketch for the Base** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) of the coordinate system. 3. **Create Lines in Sketch** Draw 8 connected line segments as follows: - line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.0] - line_2: [0.25, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.125] - line_3: [0.25, 0.125] to [0.75, 0.125] - line_4: [0.75, 0.125] to [0.75, 0.375] - line_5: [0.75, 0.375] to [0.25, 0.375] - line_6: [0.25, 0.375] to [0.25, 0.5] - line_7: [0.25, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.5] - line_8: [0.0, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.0] This will form a closed loop, describing one of the end faces (top or bottom) of the prism. 4. **Close Loop and Create Face** Ensure the loop is closed and create the face_1 associated with this loop. 5. **Scale the Sketch** Scale the drawing by 75% using the sketch scaling parameter. 6. **Transform Sketch into 3D** With the scaled 2D sketch, transform it into a 3D sketch, applying a 3D rotation using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 7. **Extrude the Sketch** Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis (normal) by 0.75 units, and along the opposite direction of the normal by 0 units. 8. **Describe the First Part** Describe the part: - Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with tapered top and bottom. - Length: approximately 2 - Width: approximately 3 - Height: approximately 4 This finished part will be used to create the final shape of the prism. Continue with joining or cutting operations, if applicable, based on the 'operation' directive for the next part(s) supplied in the JSON instructions.</description>
